medium: Earthenware with underglaze floral decor on brown slip
title: Plate
text: Some of the most beautiful wares of the Samanid dynasty (819'1005) were painted in a black slip over a white background. The standard decorative vocabulary consists of interlaced motifs, scrollwork, geometric designs, and precisely arranged <I>kufic<I> calligraphy.
description: Terra cotta plate with conventionalized floral design in very dark brown on white ground. Repaired, but no restoration.
creditline: The Katherine Kittredge McMillan Memorial Fund
